title: Text
definition: Text is a utility component that allows you to apply Blueprints typographic styles to text. It helps you to quickly create text-based content that is consistent with the rest of the Blueprint components.

content.title: Typographic styles
content.leading: This is a demo of different typographic styles available in the Text component. This example is also using Divider component and Space utility that are commonly used with Text component.

data: Paragraph text is your default text style. Use it for paragraphs, lists, and other long-form content.
Semantic equivalent to `h1` tag. Used for the main title of a page. It is the largest and most prominent text style. Use it only once per page or view.
Semantic equivalent to `h2` tag. Used for the main title of a section. It is the second largest and prominent text style. Use it to separate the highest level sections of a page.
Semantic equivalent to `h3` tag. Use it to further divide sections into subsections.
Semantic equivalent to `h4` tag. Use it for the title of cards, modals, and other small sections.
Leading text introduces the content of the page. Use it in combination with `jumbo` or `title` as an excerpt or a quick overview of what the page is about.

Caption text is designed for labeling objects like images, graphs. It also can be used on the first sentence of list items, as a way to give user to quickly scan the list. It is a prominent text style that is best for short, descriptive text.
Description is a small, secondary text best used for additional information or context. One of the primary use cases for `description` is to be used in conjunction with `caption` label images.
Code text style is used to represent code snippets. It is a monospaced font and is used to display code or code-like text.

content.title: Color variants
content.leading: Text comes with decorative and semantic colors.
